name: Len Duncan
introduction: Len Duncan (born 25 July 1911 and died 1 August 1998) was an American racing driver who participated in four Indianapolis 500 races between 1953 and 1956, when it was part of the Formula One championship. He also raced midget cars between the 1920s and 1980s, as well as the American Racing Drivers Club (ARDC) championship from 1955 to 1967. He won 8 ARDC championships.
